image.altText: Chart showing percentage of postcodes in Sydney and Adelaide that are unaffordable for the average rental household

props.synopsis: Exclusive data released to the ABC reveals the depth of the nation's rental crisis. In two capital cities 70 per cent of postcodes are unaffordable, as are over half the suburbs in others.

title.children: Australia's most unaffordable city to rent in might surprise you

image.altText: University students walk on the campus of University of Sydney following a graduation ceremony in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The international education sector says the Coalition's announcement of plans to cap overseas students at 25 per cent of university cohorts if elected in May came out of the blue.

title.children: Sector slams Coalition uni plan as 'out of Donald Trump's playbook'

image.altText: Elon musk stands behind donald trump in the oval office with his arms folded

props.synopsis: With US President Donald Trump's tariffs risking a global trade war and a US recession, the Australian share market is set to dive when it opens on Monday morning.

title.children: Australian dollar plunges as Elon Musk hopes for 'zero-tariff situation'

image.altText: An illustration treatment of Donald Trump, from behind, walking between two curtains

props.synopsis: Some of America’s strongest allies are rethinking their relationship as Donald Trump’s isolationism threatens to entirely remake the West.

title.children: Two months into Trump's term, there's been another vibe shift

image.altText: Tony Rundle wears a pink collared shirt

props.synopsis: Tony Rundle, the Tasmanian Liberal premier who championed tougher gun laws after the Port Arthur massacre, has died.

title.children: Former Tasmanian premier Tony Rundle dies at age of 86

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks in front of the Australian, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander flags.

props.synopsis: The prime minister holds a rally for the party faithful in Queensland, where the government holds just five of the state's 30 seats. Follow live.

title.children: Albanese rallies party faithful as Coalition details foreign student cuts

image.altText: GettyImages-2208189374

props.synopsis: A heated brawl launches the Port and St Kilda game in Adelaide, as Jesse Hogan has a career day for the Giants. Follow live.

title.children: Mass brawl launches Saints and Power clash, as Hogan kicks a bag for Giants

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: HT: St Kilda 9.6 (60) lead Port Adelaide 5.7 (37)
QT: St Kilda 6.4 (40) lead Port Adelaide 2.4 (16)
FT: GWS Giants 20.12 (132) defeat West Coast 7.9 (51)

image.altText: Moses Leo runs in a try for New Zealand in rugby sevens at the Paris Olympic Games.

props.synopsis: Melbourne halfback Jahrome Hughes is back from a broken hand and Olympic rugby sevens player Moses Leo makes his NRL debut as the Storm's rivalry with Manly resumes at Brookvale Oval. Follow live.

title.children: Olympian on debut for Storm as Hughes returns against Manly

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Manly gets the try they've been looking for
Anderson starts it and finishes for Melbourne

image.altText: A police van out the of apartments

props.synopsis: Police have launched a homicide investigation into a stabbing at Bowen Hills in Brisbane's inner north on Sunday morning.

title.children: Man stabbed to death in inner Brisbane, homicide investigation launched

image.altText: Peter Dutton talking

props.synopsis: The Trump effect is becoming a vicious political accelerant. While he might be the left's worst nightmare, the US president may cause the most damage to the right.

title.children: Alarm bells start to ring for Dutton's campaign after Trump's tariff rampage

image.altText: A crowd of protesters hold signs up against Trump

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands of protesters take part in an anti-Trump protest across 1,200 locations in what is expected to be the largest single day of protest against Mr Trump and his billionaire ally Elon Musk.

title.children: 'Our country is under attack': Thousands protest Trump and Musk in rallies across US

image.altText: Joey Spencer on the canvas after being knocked down by Tim Tszyu.

props.synopsis: Tim Tszyu beats Joey Spencer by fourth round TKO in their super welterweight clash at the Newcastle Entertainment Centre.

title.children: Tim Tszyu crushes Spencer, returns to winning ways to resurrect career

image.altText: A woman wearing green smiles, with a background of flowers and a green garden.

props.synopsis: Opening her first store in 1982, Ms Cutten's fashion line graced the wardrobes of Australians for more than four decades.

title.children: Fashion designer Perri Cutten dies aged 73

image.altText: Thumb_Battery-subsidy-thumb-rooftop-solar

props.synopsis: If you already have solar or are considering getting a new solar-and-battery system, we've answered some questions you might have on batteries and how they could work for your household.

title.children: A battery for about $5k could cover most households' needs, experts say

image.altText: Oscar Piastri walks

props.synopsis: Tactical errors cost McLaren a win in the Japanese Grand Prix as Max Verstappen leads home Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri at Suzuka.

title.children: Norris holds off Piastri's charge as McLaren finish behind Verstappen in Japan

image.altText: Dan Turner wears a black and yellow raincoat and smiles. His hair and face are wet.

props.synopsis: Dan Turner is ticking off a childhood "bucket list" dream as he races around the world in a boat he built during COVID lockdowns.

title.children: Man who built his own boat lives 'bucket list' sailing dream

image.altText: jaguar land rover pic

props.synopsis: Jaguar Land Rover will pause shipments of its Britain-made cars to the United States for a month as it considers how to mitigate the cost of Trump's 25 per cent tariff.

title.children: UK's Jaguar Land Rover to pause shipments to US over tariffs

image.altText: A row of cybertrucks

props.synopsis: As defence spending ramps up across Europe, Australia's Future Fund is investing in weapons manufacturers, Tesla and Palantir Technologies.

title.children: As Europe rearms, where is Australia's Future Fund investing?

image.altText: Three kids and an adult stand up a fence covered in debris after it was flattened by floodwaters

props.synopsis: Fixing fences and clearing dead livestock are just some of the tasks necessary as rebuilding an area double the size of Victoria begins after record-breaking floods in outback Queensland.

title.children: Properties completely 'washed away' as outback takes stock of flood damage

image.altText: Group of sheep surrounded by floodwaters

props.synopsis: As communities in Queensland reel from yet another round of devastating rain and floods, which caught people by surprise, it prompts the question: Is forecasting extreme rainfall getting harder?

title.children: Rainfall not matching the forecast have angered communities

image.altText: A mother and three kids dressed in swimmer sitting around a table eating and laughing

props.synopsis: If Easter holidays have got you confused this year, you are not alone. Here’s why the Easter school holidays are a little bit different this year and why school holidays differ state by state.

title.children: School holidays can be confusing. Here's why they vary across the country

image.altText: A man looking upset sitting on a couch.

props.synopsis: As millions of people worldwide tune in to this year's season of Married at First Sight, audiences, experts and politicians have questioned the reality TV show's response to a violent incident, less than a year after a domestic violence national emergency was declared.

title.children: As a man confesses to punching a wall, 1.8 million Australians are watching

image.altText: Hundreds of people stand outside looking toward three bodies which have been wrapped in a white and red cloth

props.synopsis: Australia has joined international demands for an independent investigation into the killing of 15 Palestinian paramedics and emergency workers in southern Gaza after Israeli forces opened fire on their convoy.

title.children: Australia joins demands for investigation into killing of Palestinian medics

image.altText: A model wearing an I love Ozempic shirt

props.synopsis: Less than 1 per cent of models during recent runway shows were plus-sized. Some fear it shows fashion is on a worrying trajectory away from inclusivity.

title.children: 'Smaller is better': Why fashion has turned its back on inclusivity

image.altText: A composite photo featuring US president Donald Trump and a cooked piece of steak.

props.synopsis: Cattle Australia says Donald Trump fails to recognise that the US has had access to the Australian market since 2019, provided it can demonstrate its beef comes from cattle born, raised and slaughtered in the US.

title.children: Department confirms there's no ban on importing US beef

image.altText: A middle aged woman with long brown hair and pink rimmed glasses smiling

props.synopsis: A project led by autistic people has been holding events and training staff at some of Australia’s biggest arts institutions to help them become more inclusive.

title.children: One of the biggest myths about autistic people — and why it isn't true

image.altText: A man in a navy suit points his finger in parliament

props.synopsis: The British foreign ministry has criticised Israel after the country detained two UK MPs.

title.children: Two British MPs refused entry into Israel, UK foreign ministry says

image.altText: A hole in the door, messy on the floor, dirty carpet and broken furniture are visible

props.synopsis: People with mental illness are getting lost in the NDIS system, isolated from friends and family and abandoned while their lucrative government funding is drained. This is how they're living.

title.children: Inside these homes, the cost of alleged NDIS fraud is laid bare

image.altText: A Sam Lim corflute on a path with a Howard Ong corflute in the background.

props.synopsis: Winning back Tangney will be the Liberals' "number one" target in WA, according to one political expert, but Labor — buoyed by its success in the area in the recent state election, won't be handing it back without a fight.

title.children: 'Number one target': This WA seat is a top priority for the Liberals

image.altText: A family portrait of mum, dad and a kid taken on a street with houses in the background.

props.synopsis: Two of Australia's marginal seats may have become "more marginal" after the recent redrawing of boundaries. The ABC visited the electorates ahead of the federal election to find out what issues some of those voters cared most about.

title.children: Chinese-Australian voters reveal key issues ahead of federal election

image.altText: A plant with a long stem and purple flowers on the end

props.synopsis: There are tens of thousands of exotic ornamental plants sold in Australian nurseries but fewer than a quarter have been assessed for their potential to become an invasive weed.

title.children: Garden stores a 'hot mess' of what could be the next invasive weeds

image.altText: an airasia plane flies in a blue sky

props.synopsis: A NSW court has been told Jordanian national, Shadi Taisser Ayed Alsaaydeh, had taken medication and a sleeping pill, and had no recollection of the incident on the AirAsia flight.

title.children: Man on Sydney-bound flight allegedly tried to open doors, choke staff member

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: So, you think you're good at quizzes but don't have the guts to front up to my actual TV show? Well, try this then.

title.children: Ready to flex your trivia muscle? Let's play, HARD!
